result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J Roffers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 77 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 13CM2182

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Target from case 13CM2182 ($231.91) and case 13CM2183 ($337.90) to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Inform Agent and any treating physician of all prescriptions. Fill all prescriptions at the same pharmacy. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

ADDRESS INFO for Lucas J Roffers
Current: 2791 CTH C, Port Washington, WI 53074 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2017)
Prior: C/O Dodge Correctional Institution, 1 W Lincoln St, Waupun, WI 53963 United States
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 10/08/15 sentencing hearing

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

2  1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 77 days)     **CONCURRENT**
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent and any treating physicians of all prescriptions
____Fill all prescriptions at same pharmacy
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $231.91 for Case #13CM2182 & $337.90 for case #13CM2183 - both to Target (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH**
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from DCI.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Bound over.  Information is filed.  Reading is waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Count #2 is dismissed and read-in. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into Milwaukee DTC.  Court signs Deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.

Defendant to have no contact with businesses listed in the Criminal Complaint. No contact with any victim/witnesses listed in the complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of release.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton for  Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
